sub.title: Adult Dosing
sub.mono:
• The US Food and Drug Administration has received reports of medication errors due to confusion about the strengths of component drugs listed on the vial. Each vial contains 1.5 g total (equivalent to ceftolozane 1 g and tazobactam 0.5 g).
  • Complicated urinary tract infection: 1.5 g (ceftolozane 1 g/tazobactam 0.5 g) IV infused over 1 hour every 8 hours for 7 days; duration is dependant on severity and site of infection and clinical and bacteriological progress
  • Infectious disease of abdomen, Complicated disease, in combination with metronidazole: 1.5 g (ceftolozane 1 g/tazobactam 0.5 g) IV infused over 1 hour every 8 hours for 4 to 14 days, depending on severity and site of infection and clinical and bacteriological progress; give with metronidazole 500 mg IV every 8 hours
  • Pyelonephritis: 1.5 g (ceftolozane 1 g/tazobactam 0.5 g) IV infused over 1 hour every 8 hours for 7 days; duration is dependant on severity and site of infection and clinical and bacteriological progress

sub.title: Pediatric Dosing
sub.mono: Safety and efficacy have not been established in pediatric patients.

sub.title: Dose Adjustments
sub.mono:
• Renal impairment, mild: No adjustment recommended
  • Renal impairment (estimated CrCl 30 to 50 mL/min): Reduce to ceftolozane 500 mg/tazobactam 250 mg IV infused over 1 hour every 8 hours.
  • Renal impairment (estimated CrCl 15 to 29 mL/min): Reduce to ceftolozane 250 mg/tazobactam 125 mg IV infused over 1 hour every 8 hours.
  • ESRD on hemodialysis: Single loading dose of ceftolozane 500 mg/tazobactam 250 mg IV infused over 1 hour followed by ceftolozane 100 mg/tazobactam 50 mg IV infused over 1 hour every 8 hours for the remainder of the treatment period; dialysis days, give the dose at the earliest time following dialysis completion
  • Hepatic impairment: No adjustment recommended
  • Geriatric: No adjustments recommended; select dose carefully and base on renal function
  • Race: No adjustment recommended

sub.title: Indications
sub.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Complicated urinary tract infection
  • Infectious disease of abdomen, Complicated disease, in combination with metronidazole
  • Pyelonephritis

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: hypersensitivity to ceftolozane, tazobactam, piperacillin/tazobactam, or any other beta-lactams.

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• Gastrointestinal:
  • -- Clostridium difficile-associated diarrhea has been reported, including cases occurring more than 2 months after administration; discontinue use and institute appropriate medical management if suspected or confirmed
  • Immunologic:
  • -- Serious and possibly fatal hypersensitivity reactions have been reported
  • -- Cross sensitivity may occur
  • -- Increased risk of developing drug-resistant bacteria if administered in absence of proven or strongly suspected bacterial infection
  • Renal:
  • -- Decreased efficacy has been reported in patients with baseline creatinine clearance of 30 to less than or equal to 50 mL/min; monitoring recommended
  • -- Increased risk of adverse effects in patients with moderate or severe renal impairment and those with ESRD on hemodialysis; monitoring recommended and dose adjustments required
  • Other:
  • -- Increased risk of adverse effects in elderly patients; monitoring recommended and dose adjustments may be warranted

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Gastrointestinal:Diarrhea (6.2%), Nausea (2.8% to 7.9%)
  • Neurologic:Headache (2.5% to 5.8%)
  • Other:Fever (1.7% to 5.6%)
Serious
  • Gastrointestinal:Clostridium difficile diarrhea
  • Immunologic:Hypersensitivity reaction
  • Renal:Renal impairment (Less than 1%)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Ceftolozane is a cephalosporin class bactericidal agent that inhibits bacterial cell wall synthesis by binding to penicillin-binding proteins (PBPs). Tazobactam has low affinity for PBPs, but does irreversibly inhibit certain penicillinases and cephalosporinases and covalently binds to some chromosomal and plasmid-mediated bacterial beta-lactamases.

sub.title: Absorption
sub.mono:
• Ceftolozane, Tmax, IV: 1.07 hours
  • Tazobactam, Tmax, IV: 1.01 hours

sub.title: Distribution
sub.mono:
• Ceftolozane, Protein binding: 16% to 21%
  • Ceftolozane, Vd: 13.5 L
  • Tazobactam, Protein binding: 30%
  • Tazobactam, Vd: 18.2 L

sub.title: Metabolism
sub.mono:
• Ceftolozane: Negligible
  • Tazobactam: Hydrolysis
  • Tazobactam: Substrate of OAT1 transporter and OAT3 transporter

sub.title: Excretion
sub.mono:
• Ceftolozane, Renal: Greater than 95% unchanged
  • Ceftolozane, Renal clearance: 3.41 to 6.69 L/hr
  • Ceftolozane, Total body clearance: 4.1 to 6.73 L/hr (ceftolozane)
  • Tazobactam, Renal: Greater than 80% unchanged
  • Dialyzable: Yes, approximately two-thirds removed

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Intravenous
  • Reconstitute vial with 10 mL of sterile water or NS for injection and gently shake to yield a final concentration of 1.5 g (ceftolozane 1 g/tazobactam 0.5 g) per 11.4 mL.
  • Further dilute the reconstituted solution within 1 hour.
  • Do not administer reconstituted drug without further dilution.
  • Dilute by adding desired volume to 100 mL of NS or D5W. Add 11.4 mL for concentration of 1.5 g (ceftolozane 1 g/tazobactam 0.5 g dose), 5.7 mL for 750 mg (ceftolozane 500 mg/tazobactam 250 mg dose), 2.9 mL for 375 mg (ceftolozane 250 mg/tazobactam 125 mg dose), or 1.2 mL for 150 mg (ceftolozane 100 mg/tazobactam 50 mg dose).
  • Do not mix with other drugs or solutions containing other drugs.
  • Administer the diluted solution within 24 hours if stored at room temperature, or within 7 days when refrigerated (2 to 8 degrees C or 36 to 46 degrees F).
  • Do not freeze either the reconstituted or diluted solution.
  • Administer all doses via IV infusion over 1 hour.

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• Improvement in signs and symptoms of infection are indicative of efficacy
  • Patients with changing renal function; CrCl at least daily
  • Elderly patients; consider monitoring renal function.

11.title: How Supplied
11.mono:
Zerbaxa
Intravenous Powder for Solution: (Ceftolozane - Tazobactam) 1 GM-0.5 GM

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Side effects include nausea, headache, and pyrexia.
  • Instruct patient to report severe watery or bloody diarrhea, which may occur more than 2 months after last dose.
  • Advise patient to call healthcare professional if a treatment is missed, as drug should be given on a regular schedule and patient should complete the full course of therapy.
